Class: Chrono

Chrono()

This class calculates time lapses between two points on time.

Constructor

new Chrono()

Constructor

Source:
  • chrono.js, line 8

Members

offset :number

If you set an offset in a chrono, its value will be added getDeltaTime and stop.

Type:
  • number
Source:
  • chrono.js, line 32
Example
let chrono = new Chrono()
chrono.offset = 500
chrono.start()
process.sleep(500)
chrono.stop() // Will return 1000

clone() → {Chrono}

Creates a copy of the chrono.

Source:
  • chrono.js, line 69
Returns:

Cloned chrono

Type
Chrono

getDeltaTime() → {number|null}

Returns the time between start() and the last stop() in ms. Returns null if start wasn't
called.

Source:
  • chrono.js, line 40
Returns:

Time lapse in ms.

Type
number | null

reset()

Reset chrono values.

Source:
  • chrono.js, line 13

start()

Starts the chrono.

Source:
  • chrono.js, line 51

stop() → {number|null}

Stops the timer and returns delta time.

Source:
  • chrono.js, line 60
Returns:

Returns the delta time

number | null
